page.title: 09A WALK TO THE RIVERBANK
page.content:
{Observations by an eight year old.}
We went for a walk to the riverbank. We saw a train and a bus at the station. The tide was out and an old boat had paint peeling off. It was on some sinking mud. The things I liked best were the ladybirds and the wind-surfers. The ladybirds were giving each other a piggyback and they crawled up my arm. A wind surf board is made of fibre glass with one nylon sail. It has a man to steer it who kept falling in the water and another man helped him back onto the board. There was also a man in a canoe stuck in some reeds.
